title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes creating positive environment include: Using welcoming inclusive language respectful differing viewpoints experiences Gracefully accepting constructive criticism Focusing best community Showing empathy towards community members responsible work, language, conducts collaborative team work improve efficiency quality work Examples unacceptable behavior participants include: use sexualized language imagery unwelcome sexual attention advances Trolling, insulting/derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Insults jokes others Swearing Publishing others’ private information, physical electronic address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Contributing to tweetRpoll
text: outlines propose change tweetRpoll. Contributions welcome, greatly appreciated! Every little bit helps, credit always given. notice bug, feature request, please open issue. ’d like contribute, can fork repository submit pull request. code maintainers team review pull requests within 7 days. detailed info contributing , tidyverse packages, please see development contributing guide.

title: Contributing to tweetRpoll
text: can fix typos, spelling mistakes, grammatical errors documentation directly using GitHub web interface, long changes made source file. generally means ’ll need edit roxygen2 comments .R, .Rd file. can find .R file generates .Rd reading comment first line.

title: Contributing to tweetRpoll
text: want make bigger change, ’s good idea first file issue make sure someone team agrees ’s needed. ’ve found bug, please file issue illustrates bug minimal reprex (also help write unit test, needed).

title: Contributing to tweetRpoll
text: proposing feature: Explain detail work. Keep scope narrow possible, make easier implement. Remember volunteer-driven project, contributions welcome :)

title: Contributing to tweetRpoll
text: submit pull request, check meets guidelines: pull request include additional tests appropriate. pull request adds functionality, docs updated. pull request work currently supported operating systems versions R.

title: Contributing to tweetRpoll
text: Fork package clone onto computer. haven’t done , recommend using usethis::create_from_github("UBC-MDS/tweetRpoll", fork = TRUE). Install development dependences devtools::install_dev_deps(), make sure package passes R CMD check running devtools::check(). R CMD check doesn’t pass cleanly, ’s good idea ask help continuing. Create Git branch pull request (PR). recommend using usethis::pr_init("brief-description--change"). Make changes, commit git, create PR running usethis::pr_push(), following prompts browser. title PR briefly describe change. body PR contain Fixes #issue-number. user-facing changes, add bullet top NEWS.md (.e. just first header). Follow style described https://style.tidyverse.org/news.html.

title: Contributing to tweetRpoll
text: New code follow tidyverse style guide. can use styler package apply styles, please don’t restyle code nothing PR. use roxygen2, Markdown syntax, documentation. use testthat unit tests. Contributions test cases included easier accept.

title: Introduction to tweetRpoll
text: tweetRpoll R package allows users extract visualize poll data Twitter. goal make tweetRpoll helpful user-friendly; R beginner can effectively gain access data make data-driven decisions. use package, follow installation guide README install package. , import package.

title: Introduction to tweetRpoll
text: get_polls_from_user extracts tweet IDs tweets contain polls Twitter user given handle (.e. PollzOnTwitta). function requires Twitter API credentials. Users need store credentials .Renviron file root directory.

title: Introduction to tweetRpoll
text: get_poll_by_id extracts poll information poll questions, poll options, poll responses, Twitter given tweet ID returned get_polls_from_user function.
code: get_poll_by_id(1239677495487737856) #> $text #> [1] "do wear a seatbelt when you take a taxi? #poll" #>  #> $duration #> [1] 10080 #>  #> $date #> [1] "2020-03-23T22:18:41.000Z" #>  #> $`poll options` #>   position     label votes #> 1        1       yes   107 #> 2        2        no    53 #> 3        3 sometimes    11 #>  #> $user #> [1] "PollzOnTwitta" #>  #> $total #> [1] 171

title: Introduction to tweetRpoll
text: visualize_poll takes output get_poll_by_id function visualizes poll information. function provides option include additional information text box least one arguments (1) show_user, (2) show_duration, (3) show_date set True.

title: Extract Twitter Poll Data
text: goal tweetRpoll allows users extract visualize poll data (poll questions, poll options, poll responses, etc.) Twitter. goal make tweetRpoll helpful user-friendly; R beginner can effectively gain access data make data-driven decisions. particular, useful package people social media journalism, studying social media interactions.

title: Extract Twitter Poll Data
text: function returns list tweet IDs Twitter user can fed get_poll_by_id function. function extracts poll data Twitter given tweet ID. function takes output get_poll_by_id function visualizes poll information.

title: Extract Twitter Poll Data
text: existing R packages similar functionality tweets Twitter. example, tweetr package helps extract tweets, visualize user sentiment behaviors tweet posting, apply sentiment analysis data. However, available packages work specifically polls Twitter.

what: Get Poll Data from Tweet ID — get_poll_by_id
title: Get Poll Data from Tweet ID — get_poll_by_id
text: Return data.frame poll data Twitter given poll ID. output data.frame contain five columns: (1) poll_question, (2) poll_options, (3) total_responses, (4) duration, (5) date, (6) user.

title: Get Poll Data from Tweet ID — get_poll_by_id
text: tweet_id character, id tweet poll query

title: Get Poll Data from Tweet ID — get_poll_by_id
text: list

title: Get Poll Data from Tweet ID — get_poll_by_id
Get Polls from User — get_polls_from_user
text: Return data.frame poll ids given Twitter user. REQUIRES: Credentials Twitter API need stored environment variables since function calls directly bash_profile.

title: Get Polls from User — get_polls_from_user
text: username character, username twitter user query

title: Get Polls from User — get_polls_from_user
text: data.frame

title: Visualize Poll Data — visualize_poll
text: Return bar chart poll responses. Option include additional information text box least one (1) show_user, (2) show_duration, (3)show_date set True.

title: Visualize Poll Data — visualize_poll
text: poll_obj list containing poll responses get_poll_by_id() show_user logical display user show_duration logical display duration poll show_date logical display end date poll

title: Visualize Poll Data — visualize_poll
text: bar chart containing poll responses including additional information least one show_user show_duration show_date set TRUE

title: Visualize Poll Data — visualize_poll
code: poll_obj <- list() poll_obj['text'] <- 'How normal is it to shower before the gym' poll_obj['duration'] <- as.integer(1440) poll_obj['date'] <- '2022-01-12T23:08:22.000Z' poll_obj['poll options'] <- list(data.frame( 'position' = as.integer(c(1, 2, 3, 4)), 'label' = c('Not normal', 'Completely wack', 'Insane', 'Run'), 'votes' = as.integer(c(295, 124, 146, 50)))) poll_obj['user'] <- 'RadaNotSay' poll_obj['total'] <- as.integer(615) visualize_poll(poll_obj, show_duration=TRUE) #> [1] "The duration of the poll in hours: 24h"
